title: General Election 2017: Lincolnshire results - BBC News
summary: general election 2017 results and reaction from across lincolnshire .
lincoln : karen lee takes seat from karl mccartney .
boston and skegness : matt warman retains for conservatives .
boston and skegness : ukip 's paul nuttall in third .
gainsborough : edward lee retains for conservatives .
grantham and stamford : nick boles retains for conservatives .
louth and horncastle : victoria atkins retains for conservatives .
sleaford and north hykeham : caroline johnson retains for conservatives .
south holland and the deepings : john hayes retains for conservatives .

documents.title: the new political in lincolnshire
text: that 's it from me after a somewhat busy few hours , but before i go here 's a quick rundown of the thrills and spills we 've had in lincolnshire as the general election results flowed in :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : lincoln 's young voters have their say
text: labour 's success in lincoln has been put down in part to the number of young people coming out to vote .
lincoln has a large number of university students and we asked young people in the city what persuaded them to vote :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: man dies in crash near grantham
text: a 20-year-old man has died after the car he was driving came off the road at londonthorpe near grantham and overturned .
it happened at about 22:35 yesterday night on high road , police say .
a 19-year-old local man who was a passenger in the car was taken to queens medical centre in nottingham where he remains in a very serious condition .
anyone who witnessed the incident or has any information is being asked to get in touch with police .

documents.title: lincolnshire 's mental health services 'good ' - health watchdog
text: lincolnshire 's mental health services have been rated `` good '' by a national health watchdog .
the care quality commission report follows an inspection carried out in april which said services at lincolnshire partnership nhs foundation trust required improvement overall .
the latest report says supervision and maintenance of patient records still need improving though , and demand on beds and acute care remain high - reflecting national pressures .
but , safety , caring and responsive staff and leadership are all rated good , the report says .

documents.title: lincoln 's new mp aims to continue nursing
text: karen lee , lincoln 's new labour mp , also happens to be a nurse at lincoln county hospital .
she 's preparing to take her seat at westminster after having pushed out conservative karl mccartney .
despite this , she says she hopes she can still do some nursing shifts as well as carrying out her duties as the city 's new mp .
ms lee says : `` i would really like to carry on , perhaps doing the odd bank shift and keep my registration current .
i had to work very hard to be a nurse and i enjoy being a nurse . ''

documents.title: extra police kept close eye on election counts
text: there were extra officers on duty at election counts across the country last night .
these officers were on patrol at the guildhall in hull :
and there were armed officers on duty at the count in boston :

documents.title: kim edwards : 'i never got on with my mum '
text: kim edwards : 'i never got on with my mum '

documents.title: spalding murders : daughter kim edwards named as killer
text: the couple believed to be britain 's youngest double murderers have been named , after a judge lifted a ban on identifying them .
kim edwards and her boyfriend lucas markham murdered edwards ' mother elizabeth , 49 , and her younger sister katie , 13 , at their home in spalding , lincolnshire , in april 2016 .
the killers , who were 14 at the time , were both jailed in november .
a bid to stop their names being made public was rejected in the high court .

documents.title: general election rundown for lincolnshire
text: wow , what a rollercoaster of a day so far in the aftermath of the general election !
here 's a rundown of what 's happened here in lincolnshire :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: breakingprime minister to meet the queen
text: theresa may has just left downing street for buckingham palace .
despite failing to win a majority in the general election , she 's expected to ask the queen for permission to form a new government .

documents.title: watch : ukip leader 's resignation speech
text: paul nuttall has conceded defeat both as ukip 's leader and as candidate for the boston and skegness constituency where he came third in the general election .
resigning his post as leader of the party , this is some of what mr nuttall had to say :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln mp adds to record number of female mps elected
text: there 'll be more than 207 women in this parliament following the general election , outnumbering the 196 women elected in 2015 .
about 30 % of general election candidates were women this year - up from the previous record of 26 % in 2015 .
one of those women is karen lee , who 's won the lincoln seat for labour by beating conservative karl mccartney into second place :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: nuttall quits after 'hubristic , foolish and politically naive ' election
text: more on the news that ukip leader paul nuttall 's announced at a press conference in boston , lincolnshire , that he 's resigning his post .
he says the party 's been a victim of its own success .
he came third in boston and skegness .
mr nuttall says : `` we forced the referendum and we helped win brexit and some people mistakenly think our job is done but it 's not .
`` what a hubristic , foolish and politically naive election to call .
it has put our brexit at risk . ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: breakingukip leader nuttall resigns
text: paul nuttall has resigned as the leader of ukip after his party failed to gain a single seat in westminster .
he stood for election in the boston and skegness constituency and came third .

documents.title: brigg and goole mp : corbyn 'dangerous '
text: andrew percy has held his seat for the conservatives in brigg and goole , but he says the results for the party nationally are `` sad '' .
he says : `` i 've supported theresa may from day one .
i think it 's very sad , actually , that the results are as they have been .
`` the people of this country voted to leave the european union and the idea that somebody like jeremy corbyn would be negotiating for us is just dangerous . ''

documents.title: watch : ringing endorsement for jeremy corbyn from new lincoln mp
text: karen lee 's been speaking as the new labour mp for lincoln .
she won with a majority of more than 1,500- taking the seat from the conservative 's karl mccartney .
author: Tim Iredale
Political editor, East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincs mp - 'i think we 're in for an interesting few days '
text: the conservative mp for louth & horncastle victoria atkins has been reacting to her re- election .
she won the seat comfortably with a majority of 19,641 votes .

speaking after the result ms atkins says 'i 'm absolutely delighted that i 've been given the chance to continue working hard for louth & horncastle i think we 're in for an interesting few days if i can put it that way . '
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: 25,000 majority for tories in south holland & the deepings
text: john hayes held south holland and the deepings for the conservatives .
he received 35,179 votes- that 's 70 % of the vote .

mr hayes says 'i care about this place , i think they know i care about it , they 've entrusted me as their member of parliament and i will repay them with all of my effort , with all of my commitment and with all of my dedication . ''
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: the result was written in the skies all along !
text: guess last night 's sky of 'every kind of weather ahead ' was a pretty accurate prediction of election night after all .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: ukip vote slashed in boston & skegness
text: ukip 's paul nuttall was pushed into third position getting 3,308 votes .
that 's a cut of more 11,000 votes compared with 2015 .
matt warman retained the seat for the conservatives , boosting his share of the vote by almost 20 % .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'you ca n't take people for granted '
text: gainsborough stays blue this morning as sir edward leigh retains the seat for the conservatives .
he got 31,790 votes with labour 's catherine tite second with 14,767 votes .
despite getting more than 60 % of the vote he said :
`` you ca n't take people for granted and that 's why i 've worked it as hard as i can .
if you take people for granted you will gradually get your vote whittled away which has not happened here yet . ''
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Lincolnshire

documents.title: conservatives increase their share in boston & skegness
text: matt warman retained the boston & skegness seat for the conservatives and increased his share of the vote by more than 60 % .
the ukip leader paul nuttall was beaten into third place with labour 's paul kenny second .

mr warman said 'i think we saw a very clear and total collapse in the ukip vote here i think it 's a lazy assumption to assume that a constituency that backed leaving the eu would necessarily vote for a single issue pressure group . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire

documents.title: great grimsby mp : 'it 's been a strange election '
text: lab hold great grimsby - melanie onn gives reax to @ twitterid # ge2017 # videotweet

documents.title: new mp for lincoln
text: lincoln is waking up to the news the city has a new mp this morning .
after seven years the conservative 's karl mccartney has lost the seat to labour 's karen lee .
she clinched it by more than 1,500 votes .

karen lee said `` i 'm very proud to have been chosen to represent the city i was born in and lived in all my life i 'm looking forward to representing students , long terms residents and everyone in the constituency . ''
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: hung parliament : what happens now ?
text: the general election has ended in a hung parliament , meaning no party can reach an overall majority .
so what happens now ?
here 's your answer .

documents.title: heavy losses for ukip in 'brexit capital '
text: heavy losses for ukip in 'brexit capital '

documents.title: general election results : this is what lincolnshire looks like this morning
text: lincolnshire stays mainly blue with a splash of red .
the shock result of the night was the conservative loss of lincoln to labour .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

text: the labour party has taken lincoln .
the sitting mp karl mccartney was beaten by local councillor karen lee by 1,538 votes .
as you can see mr mccartney refused to talk to reporters after the declaration
the reaction from @ twitterid after losing his lincoln seat
rushing home to fill out mileage claim ?
@ twitterid our mate @ twitterid thought you 'd be interested to see this
it 's so good they should 've given him one of these though
haha , you 're having fun : p
this is the most fucking delicious breakfast i 've ever had
the taste of tory defeat ?
tory defeat is the sweet aftertaste of an utterly incompetent piss taker kicked out of a role he 'd neglected
rudeness has no political colour .
it was ungracious .
treat voters with contempt at your peril .
spot on maria maybe he should get himself down to sincil bank and learn grace and etiquette dcnc
they could teach many about the epitome of being gentlemen and having buckets of charisma .
ca n't wait for the new season and cowley time
me too cowley time can not come soon enough .
i did contact karl mac about campaigning at the macc match crass ignorant bigot
and he was never seen again .
for all we know , he 's still out there in the urban wilderness .

author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things you may not know about elections
text: ever wondered what happens to your ballot paper after it 's been counted or if you can take a 'selfie ' with your phone whilst casting your vote ?
well andrew flecknor , deputy acting returning officer for city of york council , has five things you might not have known about general elections .

documents.title: ukip loses 10,000 votes in boston
text: ukip leader paul nuttall saw his party 's vote fall by more than 10,000 in the boston and skegness constituency .
mr nuttall stood in the seat after the town recorded the uk 's highest pro-brexit majority in last year 's referendum .
however , ukip saw its vote drop from 14,645 in 2015 to 3,308 this time round .

text: labour win lincoln constituency

text: andrew percy has held the brigg and goole seat for the conservatives .

documents.title: the gamble that went wrong
text: nick robinson
bbcnickrobinson
the face of a woman who gambled big time & lost ( though she will probably survive as pm at first )
the face of a woman who gambled big time & lost ( though she will probably survive as pm at first )
was very disappointed to see you describe her as `` heavily made up . ''
you convey the same ( valid ) point here without playing to sexist tropes .
totally .
as a bbc employee and license payer/stakeholder , i 'm seriously upset by this .
spoiled an otherwise excellent # bbcelection show .
complaint made .
everyone 's been top notch tonight , thanks @ twitterid for letting the side down # ffs
`` heavily made up , as if she might have been in tears earlier '' oh please ! !
i ca n't stand the tories but this trash , sexist speculation
at least now she has something to talk about with hilary clinton .
how can she possibly ?
this is all of her own making .
she is finished .
`` heavily made up '' `` tears '' come on you 're better than that !
no way you would say such things about a man .
@ twitterid
and i 'm in no way an apologist for her
how can we trust her judgement ?
she 's exposed herself as a floored politician .
but at least we have a proper opposition now .
tories infighting will now be out in the open
@ twitterid called election bcus economy is crashing .
act of desperation .
# bankruptbritain wonder what markets will do ?
let 's make it less personal and much more professional shall we ?
'made up as though she 'd been crying ' that 's not news # speculation
@ twitterid will survive and she will surprise .
never underestimate her .
she maybe robotic , but robots are not made of feathers .
needs to get her 'game face ' on !
remainers did not relish this mandate mess .
a period with a pm in place approx .
3 months .
rather than strengthen her hand by with a bigger majority her misjudgement has only empowered the opposition .
author: Nick Robinson
Presenter, Radio 4 Today

documents.title: result : conservatives hold boston and skegness
text: the conservative 's matt warman has held the seat with 27,271 votes .
ukip leader paul nuttall ( above ) came third with 3,308 votes .

documents.title: south holland : conservative hold
text: south holland : conservative hold

documents.title: tory mp 'surprised ' at exit poll result
text: conservative candidate andrew percy said he was `` surprised '' at the exit poll which suggests the tories could miss out on a majority .
mr percy said it did n't seem to chime with what we were hearing on the doorstep '' .
he is defending his brigg and goole seat which he has held since 2010 .
author: Stuart Harratt
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingresult : conservative hold louth & horncastle
text: victoria atkins holds louth & horncastle for the conservative party .

documents.title: 'neck and neck ' in scunthorpe
text: still counting in north lincolnshire where conservative councillor baroness liz redfern says labour and conservatives are `` neck and neck '' in the scunthorpe constituency .
the seat is currently held by labour 's nic dakin with a majority of 3,134 .
author: Stuart Harratt
BBC Local Live

documents.title: result expected in boston in the next hour
text: the result at boston and skegness is expected to be announced within the next hour :
alex rhodes
alrhodes92
word going round that declaration expected in an hour at boston and skeg count .
# ge2017 # bbcelection

author: David McKenna
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: labour 's melanie onn re-elected in grimsby as ukip vote plummets
text: labour 's melanie onn and conservative jo gideon have both increased their share of the vote in great grimsby at the expense of ukip 's mike hookem , who polled 1,648 votes , a fall of 20.3 % from the last election .

documents.title: great grimsby : labour hold
text: great grimsby : labour hold

documents.title: 'may has put brexit in jeopardy ' says ukip 's paul nuttall
text: ukip leader paul nuttall - who is standing in the boston and skegness constituency- says theresa may has put brexit in jeopardy , if the exit poll by the bbc , itv and sky news is correct .

documents.title: result : labour hold great grimsby
text: labour 's melanie onn has been re-elected in great grimsby with 17,545 votes .

documents.title: armed police at lincolnshire election count
text: in line with the increased security following the london and manchester terrorist attacks armed police officers are at the count in boston and skegness .

documents.title: labour optimistic in lincolnshire
text: labour 's jim clarke says `` we are in it to win it '' .
mr clarke , who is standing in sleaford and north hykeham , would need to overturn a 14,000 conservative majority to take the seat .
author: Stuart Harratt
BBC Local Live

documents.title: turnout up 10 % in great grimsby
text: in a trend that seems to be mirrored in a lot of constituencies , the voter turnout in great grimsby has gone up significantly .
north east lincolnshire council say it is 67 % , up from 57 % in 2015 .
labour 's melanie onn is defending the seat with a majority of 4,540 .
author: Stuart Harratt
BBC Local Live

documents.title: candidate to miss count after cancer treatment
text: jake zuckerman
jakezuckerman
1/ i 'm told the sitting mp , nick boles wo n't be at the grantham and stamford count tonight .
he 's recently finished treatment for cancer , and
1/ i 'm told the sitting mp , nick boles wo n't be at the grantham and stamford count tonight .
he 's recently finished treatment for cancer , and
2/ is still recuperating .
his immune system is still recovering and he 's avoiding crowded places .

documents.title: counting continues in lincoln
text: the ballot boxes are in at the drill hall in lincoln .
conservative karl mccartney is defending a majority of just over 1,400 .
labour , who came second last time round , have it as down as a target seat .

documents.title: when will we know who has won ?
text: if you 're trying to decide when to go to bed or to make a quick drink then the bbc 's has this guide to when things will happen overnight .
you can also set up a message alert when your constituency declares its result so you do n't miss it .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live

documents.title: liberal democrats say 'no deal '
text: following the exit poll suggesting the conservatives will not win an overall majority the liberal democrats are apparently saying there will be no deal or coalition .
lib dem press office
libdempress
we are getting a lot of calls so just to be clear : no coalition .
no deals .
we are getting a lot of calls so just to be clear : no coalition .
no deals .
why ?
genuinely want to know .
obviously the last coalition was a disaster for ld but do you not want to help serve the country ?
because when the shit hits , it sticks on the minority party .
it 'd be like 2010-15 all over again and look where that got them .
yes i understand that , but i actually think they did a good job in coalition .
their mistake was tuition fees .
they could make difference now
i vote ld , i think they did well too .
but everyone remembers one big cock up , if that happened again it 'd ruin them .
anyway who knows if their seats would even be enough to help labour .
or if it 's even needed .
indeed .
surely they could rectify that by siding with labour who aim to abolish tuition fees ?
as we 've learnt with tuition fees , one thing to offer it and another thing to deliver it
oh come on .
you 'd rather everyone who voted for your party was left with 5 more years of tory austerity ? ? !
@ twitterid will lose my vote and membership over this i 'm sad to say .
yep .
i ca n't trust them if they 're honestly prepared to walk away from a coalition with labour & leave us to a hard brexit under the tories .
walking away from two parties that will inevitably hurt the poor is not a bad thing .
the greater danger is a second election where fatigue leads to a lower turnout and we lose the regains .
we can influence more in coalition .
no coalition .
i despise labour .
i despise the conservatives .
we are here to take over .
and i say that as a person who 's voted lib dem basically her entire adult life .
i could not care less who you vote for .
progressives alliance would be a whole different story for ld !
negotiate - insist on 2nd referendum on the deal .
make that the clincher x
they 've tried a coalition before .
it set them back 15 years
tory coalition ! ! !
totally different story .
lib dem voters are progressives
are they ?
uk needs anew centrist party .
libdem abandoned their centre policy to chase disenchanted labour voters when jc moved to hard left
sorry but what 's the point lib dem running if they wo n't do coalition ?
they ca n't be in power with a majority not in our lifetimes
we would do it but not with corbyn or may , due to their brexit stance .
corbyn wants a soft brexit that leaves us in a ( relatively ) good position .
i 'm not sure he does .
keir starmer says freedom of movement is dead , so therefore so is staying in the single market .

documents.title: postal votes 'hold the key '
text: liberal democrat candidate for the haltemprice and howden seat , david nolan , has just told me that postal votes could hold the key for the overall result .
the seat was held by david davis for the conservatives in 2015 with a majority of over 16,000 .
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: why a thursday ?
text: just why do we vote on a thursday ?
every election since the 1930s has been held on that day of the week but there is no legal requirement for elections to be held on a thursday .
here 's some thoughts on why it might have ended up an election tradition .

documents.title: dressed to count
text: are there any counters out there who are dressed more snazzily than this man in his nintendo waistcoat at the count for the boston and skegness seat ?
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: boston and skegness count : does size matter ?
text: i was a little taken aback when i arrived to cover the count for the boston and skegness seat .
as my bbc vehicle is just a bit smaller than some of the other media vans i felt a little insecure .
but size does n't matter does it ?
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: exit polls looks at possible hung parliament
text: like every other part of the country our local politicians will be reeling from the exit poll which predicts a hung parliament .
ahead of the 22:00 bst poll most of the talk in yorkshire was about labour hanging on to seats like halifax , dewsbury and scunthorpe .
the exit poll suggests that labour could not only hang retain these seats but instead win seats like morley and outwood and keighley back from the conservatives

documents.title: vote counters ready for busy night
text: it 's me and david harrison at the guildhall in hull tonight .
all the hull parliamentary seats will be declared here this evening .
the first counters have arrived and are set up .
and the ballot boxes have begun to arrive .
author: Matthew Bone
Video Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: first ballot boxes arrive
text: matthew bone
mattbonebbc
first ballot boxes arriving in hull .
first ballot boxes arriving in hull .
that 's our ballot box , hope we make a difference .

documents.title: a long night ahead for 'unsung ' heroes
text: spare a thought for the thousands of men and women across yorkshire and lincolnshire who are working to ensure every vote is counted tonight .
from returning officers and stewards to the army of people who 'll count each and every ballot paper .
you could say they 're the unsung heroes of the electoral world .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live

documents.title: exit poll predicts conservatives largest party
text: according to the bbc/itv/sky exit poll , the conservatives are the largest party , but may be short of a majority .

documents.title: all over bar the counting
text: that 's it !
polling stations have closed across yorkshire .
registered voters were able to cast their ballots until 22:00 bst .
counting in most of the uk will take place overnight with the first results nationally expected around midnight .
yorkshire 's first results are expected in the early hours of friday morning .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good evening and welcome to our general election 2017 coverage
text: good evening and welcome to lincolnshire live 's coverage of election night 2017 .
we 'll have plenty of reaction from the winners and the losers as we bring you all the drama from counts across the county .
you can get involved too by sending us your reaction to lincolnshire 's new political landscape by clicking here .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live
